org.vngx.jsch.cipher

Class CipherImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vngx.jsch.cipher.CipherImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Algorithm, Cipher
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CipherImpl.AES128CBC, CipherImpl.AES128CTR, CipherImpl.AES192CBC, CipherImpl.AES192CTR, CipherImpl.AES256CBC, CipherImpl.AES256CTR, CipherImpl.ARCFOUR, CipherImpl.BlowfishCBC, CipherImpl.TripleDESCBC

    public class CipherImpl
extends Object
implements Cipher

    Implementation of Cipher which wraps a javax.crypto.Cipher instance from Java's JCE. The security provider for creating instances is set with the JSchConfig property defined as SSHConfigConstants.DEFAULT_SECURITY_PROVIDER; by default the default security provider will be used. If another security provider has been registered, then the security provider name in the configuration will be used when creating instances.

    Java â„¢ Cryptography Architecture (JCA) Reference Guide

    Author:
    Michael Laudati
    See Also:
    Cipher, Cipher, CipherManager, JSchConfig, SSHConfigConstants.DEFAULT_SECURITY_PROVIDER

    • Method Detail

      • getIVSize

        public int getIVSize()
        Description copied from interface: Cipher

        Returns the initialization vector size for cipher.

        An initialization vector (IV) is a block of bits that is required to allow a stream cipher or a block cipher to be executed to produce a unique stream independent from other streams produced by the same encryption key. The size of the IV depends on the encryption algorithm and on the cryptographic protocol in use and is normally as large as the block size of the cipher or as large as the encryption key.

        Specified by:
        getIVSize in interface Cipher
        Returns:
        initialization vector size
